intro: Eschscholzia lemmonii var. laxa, commonly known as the Lemmon's poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its showy, orange to red petals and is typically found in rocky habitats. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppies. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
